Class Maze

java.lang.Object
projatlab.model.Maze
public class Maze extends Object
The Maze class represents a rectangular grid of cells used in maze generation and solving. It stores the structure of the maze including the start and end cells and provides utility methods for indexing and copying the maze.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Maze(int cols, int rows)
    Constructs a Maze with the specified number of columns and rows.

  • Constructor Details

    • Maze

      public Maze(int cols, int rows)
      Constructs a Maze with the specified number of columns and rows. Initializes the grid with new Cell objects.
      Parameters:
      cols - Number of columns.
      rows - Number of rows.

  • Method Details

    • index

      public int index(int i, int j)
      Converts 2D grid coordinates (i, j) into a 1D index for the grid list.
      Parameters:
      i - Column index.
      j - Row index.
      Returns:
      Index in the grid list or -1 if out of bounds.

    • setStart

      public void setStart(Cell cell)
      Sets the start cell of the maze.
      Parameters:
      cell - The cell to designate as the starting point.

    • setEnd

      public void setEnd(Cell cell)
      Sets the end cell of the maze.
      Parameters:
      cell - The cell to designate as the ending point.

    • getCell

      public Cell getCell(int index)
      Retrieves a cell from the grid based on its 1D index.
      Parameters:
      index - The index in the grid list.
      Returns:
      The corresponding Cell object or null if the index is -1.

    • getCols

      public int getCols()
      Returns the number of columns in the maze.
      Returns:
      Column count.

    • getRows

      public int getRows()
      Returns the number of rows in the maze.
      Returns:
      Row count.

    • getGrid

      public ArrayList<Cell> getGrid()
      Returns the grid of cells in the maze.
      Returns:
      List of Cell objects.

    • getStart

      public Cell getStart()
      Returns the starting cell of the maze.
      Returns:
      Start Cell.

    • getEnd

      public Cell getEnd()
      Returns the ending cell of the maze.
      Returns:
      End Cell.

    • copy

      public Maze copy()
      Creates and returns a deep copy of this Maze object.
      Returns:
      A new Maze instance with copied Cell objects.
